name: Decline Push-Ups
how_to_perform:
1. Begin by placing your feet on an elevated surface such as a bench, box, or step. Your hands should be on the floor shoulder-width apart.
2. Walk your hands forward until your body forms a straight line from your head to your heels. This is your starting position.
3. Slowly lower your body towards the ground by bending your elbows. Keep your core tight and your body straight throughout the movement.
4. Once your chest is just above the floor, pause briefly.
5. Push through your palms to raise your body back to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
6. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Decline push-ups are a variation of push-ups where your feet are elevated above your hands, targeting the upper chest and shoulders more intensely.
